alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Washington; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL WASHINGTON...SOUTHERN ALLEGHENY AND WESTERN WESTMORELAND COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Canonsburg, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, McMurray, McKeesport, Washington, Canonsburg, Gastonville, West Mifflin, Baldwin, Upper St. Clair, Scott Township, Whitehall, South Park Township, Cecil-Bishop, Jefferson Hills, Brentwood, Dormont, Castle Shannon, and Pleasant Hills. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 17 and 28. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 30 and 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
